title: Theme Customization Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of theme development and customization workflows.

questions.question: What are 'design tokens' in the context of theming?

options.text: Platform-agnostic style values (colors, spacing, typography) that define a design system
Special HTML tags for responsive design

questions.explanation: Design tokens are named values representing design decisions — colors, spacing, font sizes, shadows. They can be expressed as CSS custom properties, JSON, or platform-specific formats, ensuring consistency across a product.

questions.question: What is the advantage of using CSS custom properties for theming?

options.text: They can be updated dynamically at runtime, enabling features like dark mode
They replace the need for classes

questions.explanation: CSS custom properties cascade and can be changed at runtime using JavaScript or media queries. This makes them ideal for theming — switching from light to dark mode by updating a few root-level variables.

questions.question: Starting a theme from scratch is always better than using a starter theme.
questions.explanation: Starter themes provide tested foundations (accessibility, responsive patterns, CMS integrations) that save development time. Starting from scratch only makes sense for very unique requirements or when learning.

questions.question: In WordPress, what does theme.json configure?

options.text: Global styles, color palettes, typography, spacing, and block editor settings

questions.explanation: theme.json is WordPress's centralized theme configuration file. It defines design tokens (colors, fonts, spacing), block editor features (which blocks are available, custom templates), and global/block-level styles.

questions.question: What is the recommended approach for implementing dark mode in a theme?

options.text: Create a completely separate CSS file for dark mode
Use CSS custom properties with a class toggle (e.g., .dark) on the root element
Use JavaScript to change every element's inline styles
Use CSS filters to invert all colors

questions.explanation: CSS custom properties on the root element, toggled by a class like .dark, is the most maintainable approach. You define color tokens once and swap them by changing the root class, affecting the entire page.
